resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: [C++] Investigate reducing I/O thread pool size to avoid CPU wastage.

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

corleyma commented on pull request #12646:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12646#issuecomment-1069826383


   Slightly tangential to this PR, but does reading parquet (in particular, from remote sources like S3)  still use the cpu thread pool, or will pyarrow users reading remote parquet potentially benefit from this newly-added ability to tune the size of the IO threadpool?


-- 
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

To unsubscribe, e-mail: github-unsubscribe@arrow.apache.org

For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

westonpace commented on pull request #12646:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12646#issuecomment-1069831892


   @corleyma That's the goal.  Although I think at the moment we sometimes incorrectly perform the read on the CPU thread pool (ARROW-14974).  We default to 8 threads which is generally pretty good for S3 but in some cases where we are reading a lot of files or files with many row groups from a remote data source, there has been a benefit from using more threads.


-- 
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

To unsubscribe, e-mail: github-unsubscribe@arrow.apache.org

For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

corleyma commented on pull request #12646:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12646#issuecomment-1069861590


   @westonpace Thanks for the prompt response and further edification.  Whenever the usage of IO threadpool is more consistent (I guess when ARROW-14974 is resolved), it might be good to update the pyarrow documentation somewhere to nudge users toward this possibility... maybe somewhere in [this section](https://arrow.apache.org/docs/python/dataset.html#reading-from-cloud-storage)?  Alternatively, adding a dedicated section for some high level discussion of Arrow's threading model as it pertains to pyarrow users could also be helpful.


-- 
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

   @pitrou There seems to be a ThreadPoolTest failing in CI (AMD64 Win C++17) but not sure if it is related to this PR. Everything else LGTM.

pitrou commented on pull request #12646:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12646#issuecomment-1072566967


   There is no ARROW_CPU_THREADS because you can use OMP_NUM_THREADS for that.


--

westonpace commented on pull request #12646:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12646#issuecomment-1072745299


   Yes, sorry I wasn't clear (and more rambling than actually suggesting a change).  We do have environment variables for both of them but the names are very different.  Also, I understand the reasoning behind the OMP_NUM_THREADS name as it has some tradition in the domain.


--

pitrou commented on pull request #12646:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12646#issuecomment-1073907043


   Right, the point is that if OMP_NUM_THREADS is already configured on a system of sorts, it automatically gets picked up by Arrow.


--

fields.summary: [C++] Allow setting IO thread pool size with an environment variable
